alert.note: Alert for Geneva (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 5:23PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Geneva and north central Holmes Counties through 600 PM CDT... At 523 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles south of Hartford, or 9 miles southeast of Geneva, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hartford, Esto, Noma, Black, Miller Crossroads, Kellys Crossroads, Bethlehem, High Bluff, Highfalls, Dundee, Holland Crossroads, Hendrix Crossroad, Ards Crossroads, Smith Crossroads, Noma Junction, Thurston and Eunola. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
